dkeep.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Abstraction of the whole game and the settings around it. It allows to construct a game with unlimited number of levels, to play, to check the status of the game and to update the level
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Game()
      Constructor of the default levels of the game

      Hero get_hero()
      Obtains Hero
      Map get_map()
      Obtains map
      void play(char key)
      Handler for all of the game logic use: checks if the game is not over, if a level it's not over and updates it if necessary, makes a play by calling the GameLogic method move
      void update_game_status()
      Updates the status of the current game in action by checking the status of the level that's being played
      void updateLevel()
      Updates the level if completed the previous

      • play

        public void play(char key)
        Handler for all of the game logic use: checks if the game is not over, if a level it's not over and updates it if necessary, makes a play by calling the GameLogic method move
        Parameters:
        key - Key that expresses the hero movement: a, 1 to left; d, 1 to the right; w, 1 upwards; s, 1 downwards

      • updateLevel

        public void updateLevel()
        Updates the level if completed the previous
